for gauge-free toe up socks with short row heel video for gauge-free socks size desired finished length of foot _________ example woman sized sock 9 length yarn used ________________________ needles ________ cast on at the toe using judy s magic cast on or the turkish cast on cast on enough stitches for the toe of the sock i suggest a total of 20 24 or 28 sts cast on for an adult sock 10 12 or 14 sts on each of the two needles make a note centre toe cast on _______ sts example for my sock centre toe cast on of 20 sts 10 sts on each needle knit the one round toe increases suggestion for increases backward loop m1l and m1r or rl1 and ll1 any increase you can work between the stitches will work increase 4 stitches every other round as follows round 1 top of foot k1 increase 1 stitch knit to 1 stitch before end of top of foot needle increase 1 stitch k1 bottom of foot k1 increase 1 stitch knit to 1 stitch before end of bottom of foot needle increase 1 stitch k1 4 sts increased round 2 knit repeat last 2 rounds until the sock toe is the width for your sock see below with an even number of stitches on the top of the foot and the bottom of the foot woman 3 5 -3 75 wide toe for 7 5 foot circumference man 4 -4 5 wide for 9 foot circumference width for foot lay your sock down and measure across for desired width knitting always measures slightly narrower when stitches are on the needle the sock is slightly wider than your measurement you can purl one round to delineate the toe example width of sock measures 3 5 on needles for my 60 stitch sock as i knit the foot it then measures 3 75 across for a 7 5 circumference for my sock measure toe to determine the length of the short row heel as follows fold the toe so that the side increase line looks like this like a short row heel measure across horizontally from outside of toe to needle and record below make a note short row heel length ________ this will be the length of the short row heel example short row heel
